title: NFL star Odell Beckham Jr. removed from Miami flight after refusing to comply with safety protocol, police say
description: NFL free agent wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. was removed from a Los Angeles-bound American Airlines flight Sunday morning at Miami International Airport after refusing to comply with safety protocol, according to a statement from the Miami-Dade Police Department.

title: Iran calls for US to be kicked out of 2022 World Cup after it changes Iran flag on social media to show support for protesters
description: Iran state media has called for the US to be kicked out of the 2022 World Cup after the United States Soccer Federation changed Iran's flag on its social media platforms to show support for protesters in Iran.

title: Antonio Banderas thinks this star actor would be a great Zorro in a reboot
description: In the age of reboots, revivals and prequels, Antonio Banderas is sharing thoughts on who would make a great choice to follow in his masked footsteps as the legendary Zorro.

title: Lionel Messi's rep denies report that Argentina captain is in negotiations with MLS' Inter Miami for next season
description: Argentina's soccer superstar Lionel Messi is not in negotiations to join Inter Miami next season, his representative tells CNN.

title: Germany salvages draw against Spain but World Cup hopes still hang in the balance
description: Niclas Füllkrug's late strike was enough to salvage a point for Germany against Spain as qualification from Group E goes down to the wire.

title: Why astrophysicist has 'very high expectations' for life beyond Earth
description: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson reacts to a discovery on Mars and what it could mean for life beyond Earth.

title: Children scream for joy after they spot Biden out shopping
description: A group of children had a surprise when they saw President Joe Biden as he passed their window during his shopping trip in Nantucket, Massachusetts.

title: Khamenei's niece arrested after calling for foreign governments to cut ties with Iranian regime
description: Farideh Moradkhani, the niece of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has been arrested after calling on foreign governments to cut all ties with the Iranian government.

title: Why protesters in China are holding up white paper
description: Protests erupted across China, including at universities, in an unprecedented show of defiance against the country's zero-Covid policy.

title: Tom Hanks and more stars share their favorite Christmas movies
description: It's that time of year to cozy up on the couch, grab a hot chocolate and watch one of the most cherished genres: holiday movies.

title: Hear protesters in China call for Xi Jinping's resignation
description: Protests erupted across China, including at universities and in Shanghai where hundreds chanted "Step down, Xi Jinping! Step down, Communist Party!" CNN's Selina Wang reports on the unprecedented show of defiance against the country's stringent and increasingly costly zero-Covid policy.

title: Russia shelled the Kherson region 54 times on Saturday, Ukrainian authorities say
Russia shelled the Kherson region 54 times on Saturday, Ukrainian authorities say
Morocco beats Belgium 2-0 in historic win
More than 1,000 US flights delayed Sunday as major airports urge passengers to arrive early
description: A severe weather system across several parts of the United States has prompted the three major airports servicing New York City to urge passengers to arrive early for flights on what is expected to be one of the busiest travel days of the year.

title: Arkansas GOP governor says Trump's meeting with Holocaust denier is 'very troubling' and 'empowering' for extremism
description: Former President Donald Trump's meeting last week with White nationalist and Holocaust denier Nick Fuentes was "very troubling" and "empowering" for extremism, Republican Gov. Asa Hutchinson said Sunday.

title: GOP governor calls Trump's dinner with a Holocaust denier and Kanye West 'very troubling'
description: Gov. Asa Hutchinson (R-AK) joins CNN's Dana Bash to discuss former President Donald Trump hosting White nationalist and Holocaust denier Nick Fuentes and rapper Kanye West at his Mar-a-Lago estate, demonstrating his continued willingness to associate with figures who have well-publicized antisemitic views as he embarks on another White House run.

title: Schiff responds to McCarthy's threat to remove him from committee
description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) responds to Rep. Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) threatening to remove him from the House Intelligence Committee if he's elected House Speaker.

title: A day of big upsets at the World Cup as Morocco shocks Belgium and Costa Rica defeats Japan
description: It was a day of big upsets at the World Cup as Belgium and Japan both succumbed to shock defeats against Morocco and Costa Rica respectively.

title: JCPenney was once a shopping giant. Can it make a comeback?
description: Marc Rosen didn't flinch when he was offered the top job at JCPenney last year.

title: Mexican authorities search for 2 missing Americans in the Gulf of California
description: Mexican authorities are searching for two Americans who went missing after a kayaking trip off the coast of Puerto Peñasco in the Gulf of California, local authorities said late Saturday.

title: Try this interval workout to avoid HIIT burnout or injuries
description: For many people aiming to burn a lot of calories, high-intensity interval training is the way to go.

title: Japan takes on Costa Rica in another day of World Cup action
Rafael Nadal says 'a part of his life left' when Roger Federer retired
description: Rafael Nadal admitted that "a part of his life left" with Roger Federer when his great rival retired from tennis -- with both players left an emotional wreck on court after the Swiss played his last ever competitive match in September at the Laver Cup.

title: Layoffs, ultimatums, and an ongoing saga over blue check marks: Elon Musk's first month at Twitter
description: Sunday officially marks one month since the world's richest man took the helm at Twitter.

title: Cycling from Paris to Doha to watch France at Qatar 2022
description: Traveling to watch their team play at the World Cup took a little longer than usual for two French fans.

title: Army veteran who took down the Colorado nightclub shooter thanks the community for its support a week after the attack
description: Richard Fierro, the Army veteran who helped take down a shooter firing upon patrons at an LGBTQ nightclub in Colorado, expressed his deep appreciation for the community's support as his family's brewery reopened the day after Thanksgiving.

title: US citizen accused of killing North Carolina woman while vacationing. Here's what we know
description: Shanquella Robinson arrived in the picturesque Mexican town of San José del Cabo on October 28 with six of her friends.

title: Taiwan's President billed midterms as all about China. Now she's resigning as party chief
description: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen has resigned as the leader of the island's ruling Democratic Progressive Party, after her party suffered heavy losses in mid-term elections.

title: North Korea plans 'world's most powerful' nuclear force, Kim Jong Un says
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is planning to build "the world's most powerful" nuclear force, state news agency KCNA reported on Sunday.

title: What travel warnings do other nations give their citizens about US violence?
description: American travelers -- at least those of the cautious variety -- might be familiar with the US State Department's travel advisories.

title: 2 weeks after police found 4 slain University of Idaho students, here's where the investigation stands
description: Two weeks after the stabbing deaths of four University of Idaho students, dozens of local, state and federal investigators are still working to determine who carried out the brutal attack.

title: West Indies cricket great David Murray dead at 72
description: David Murray, a wicketkeeper for the West Indies cricket team in the 1970s and 1980s, has died at age 72, Cricket West Indies said on Saturday.

title: Germany looks to bounce back from shock defeat and revive World Cup hopes against dangerous Spain
description: If Germany is to avoid the ignominy of consecutive World Cup group stage exits, it will need to earn a positive result against a Spain side that looked like the tournament's most dangerous team after the opening round of fixtures.

title: Protests erupt across China in unprecedented challenge to Xi Jinping's zero-Covid policy
description: Protests are erupting across China, including at universities and in Shanghai where hundreds chanted "Step down, Xi Jinping! Step down, Communist Party!", in an unprecedented show of defiance against the country's stringent and increasingly costly zero-Covid policy.

title: 'Really big deal': Retired colonel breaks down new Russian strategy
description: Russia's widespread missile attacks on Ukraine's critical infrastructure caused the temporary shutdown of many Ukrainian power plants. Retired Air Force Col. Cedric Leighton explains Russia's shift in strategy.

title: World Cup fans stopped by security officials for wearing rainbow-colored items
description: The World Cup is well underway in Qatar, but issues surrounding LGBTQ+ rights for the Gulf state, world soccer governing body FIFA, teams and fans just won't go away.

title: Polish PM: Russia is failing on the battlefield, so it resorts to 'death, starvation and hypothermia'
